intro: Crepinia pouzinii, commonly known as the Malagasy crepe jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the rainy season, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
